#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Avoid Least Effective Life Hacks
#Text=Life can be challenging at times , which is why people come up with new innovative ideas to save you time , money and make your life easier .
#Text=While many life hacks are fantastic , there are many that are more difficult to implement than your current method and some hacks provide few beneficial results .

#Text=If you have common sense , most suggestions will seem intuitive , but if your common sense is somewhat lacking , it will pay you to carefully examine each life hack that you plan to implement and learn how to identify the life hacks which are inefficient or counterproductive .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Stop using hacks that require small objects .
#Text=For example , paperclips do not help organize cables and do not help people find the end of a roll of tape .
#Text=Also , do n't use the ends of pants hangers as clips around the house .
#Text=They will just get scattered , lost , broken , misplaced and are impossible to keep track of .
#Text=Avoid collecting clutter .
#Text=You may have seen people collecting juice bottles to use when they lose their dustpans , as well as can tabs to use as fishing hooks and to hang clothes with .
#Text=Do n't do this .
#Text=That way , you can avoid becoming a hoarder and letting useless items inhibit your day-to-day routine .
#Text=Fend off organizational life hacks .
#Text=Some people use bread clips to hang off cords and cables so that they can be labelled .
#Text=Hacks like these are tedious and tend to waste more time than they save .
#Text=It is best to avoid spending massive amounts of time on organizing your possessions .
#Text=Instead , focus on keeping your possessions to a minimum and strive to keep those items that you often use readily accessible .
#Text=Use stuff for what it is supposed to be used for .
#Text=A lot of people use the life hack where you use a ketchup bottle to pour out pancake mess .
#Text=Ironically , by the time you get the pancake mix in and when you clean it out , you are left with more mess and hassle .
#Text=Some people even use their shoe organizers to put cleaning chemicals in , and then they wonder where to put their shoes .
#Text=Restrict yourself to buying only things you do n't already have .
#Text=Having to go out and buy something for a specific purpose is not a life hack .

#Text=Heaps of life hacks involve using a shoe organizer to organize anything such as cleaning chemicals , but this hack is only useful to people who have a shoe organizer they are not using lying around their house .
#Text=Otherwise you will may as well buy something which has already been designed for the purpose .
#Text=Avoid being a perfectionist .
#Text=Taking extra time to do something perfectly is a waste of your life and annoying to other people .
#Text=Life hackers have come up with easy ways to fold your clothes , but what is even quicker and easier is to shove your clothes in the drawer and not be a folding freak , for example .
#Text=Use your common sense .
#Text=Decide whether the hack is too good to be true , more effort to perform then doing something the conventional way , or just not worth your while .

#Text=For example , just by looking at a recipe for homemade gin , you can see it costs more , takes forever and has lots of ingredients you would n't normally have , so do n't , just buy some good old mother 's ruin from the liquor store .
#Text=Restrict yourself from wasting your time .

#Text=Spare yourself the disappoint of finding out that balancing a spoon on a pot of boiling water , making a speaker out of a toilet roll , using a toaster to make a sandwich and adding salt to decrease the boiling point of water does n't work .
